CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING
MAY 13, 2019
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, May 13, 2019

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Marc C. McGovern

Dennis J. Carlone

May 13, 2019

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-132, regarding consulting with the City of Somerville relative to proposed traffic
circulation and urban design changes in Davis Square and to better understand the impact that these
changes might have on Cambridge.
CMA 2019 #132
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $2,500, donated from the Carl Barron Awards for Administrative Excellence to the Fire
Department Grant Fund Other Ordinary Maintenance account.
CMA 2019 #133
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

3. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $100,800 from Free Cash to the General Fund Fire Department Other Ordinary Maintenance
account to cover the cost of equipment and screening for 10 new firefighters.
CMA 2019 #134
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 18-139, regarding the possibility of planting a tree at the corner of Inman Street and
Massachusetts Avenue, directly in front of City Hall.
CMA 2019 #135
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the City of
Cambridge Getting to Net Zero Action Plan Fiscal Year 2018 Progress Report.
CMA 2019 #136
RESULT:
REFERRED TO HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL COMMITTEE

PAGE 2

May 13, 2019

II. CALENDAR

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) AWAITING HOME RULE LEGISLATION-BEFORE PROPOSAL CAN BE
ORDAINED
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections. PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the proposed
Cannabis Business Permitting Ordinance. ON OR AFTER APRIL 22, 2019 THE QUESTION
COMES ON PASSAGE TO BE ORDAINED
CMA 2019 #86
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

4. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $3,000,000 to provide funds for the Municipal
Facilities Improvement Plan. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #103
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

5. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $800,000 to provide funds for various Schools for
repairs to entrance doors, upgrade of energy management software, replacement of analog phone
system with the voice over internet protocol (VOIP), and the replacement of an emergency
generator. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #97
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

May 13, 2019

6. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $20,500,000 to provide funds for various water
pollution abatement projects, including construction of sewer separation, storm water
management and combined sewer overflow reduction elimination improvements within the
Alewife area. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #100
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

7. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $4,000,000 to provide funds for the reconstruction of
various City streets and sidewalks. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES
ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #99
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

8. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $10,000,000 to provide funds for the construction of
improvements at City Hall. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #102
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

9. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $22,000,000 to provide funds for the construction of
improvements at the Fire Station Headquarters Building located at 491 Broadway. ON OR
AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #98
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

10. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $4,000,000 to provide design and construction of Eliot
Street between JFK St. and Brattle St. which is a continuation of the Harvard Square Kiosk and
Plaza and Surface Enhancement project. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION
COMES ON ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #101
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

May 13, 2019

11. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation and authorization to borrow $10,000,000 to provide funds for the design and
reconstruction of the Tobin School building. If approved, this appropriation will be included in
the City’s FY20 bond issue. ON OR AFTER MAY 6, 2019 THE QUESTION COMES ON
ADOPTION
CMA 2019 #104
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 5/20/2019 5:30 PM

May 13, 2019

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. A petition was received from Gypsy Place, Sayed Mousawi, regarding outdoor seating in front of
premises numbered 90 Hampshire Street seating to include, 3 tables and 6 chairs, proposed start date
April 15, 2019 through April 15, 20121 with a start time of 7:00 AM and end time of 7:00 PM.
APP 2019 #35
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED VV9

2. An application was received from Community Development requesting permission for a temporary
banner across JFK at Mount Auburn St from July 29th to August 5th , 2019 and August 19th to
August 26th, 2019 and across Mass Ave in front of City Hall from July 29th to August 5th , 2019 and
August 19th to August 26th, 2019. This event will be held on September 20th, 2019 announcing for
Parking Day.
APP 2019 #36
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED VV9

3. An application was received from Gail Wang requesting permission for a temporary banner across
Massachusetts Avenue in front of City Hall, 795 Massachusetts Avenue from June 3, 2019 thru June
10, 2019 and at the location of JFK at Mount Auburn Street May 27, 2019 thru June 10, 2019
announcing Dragon Boat Festival held on June 9, 2019.
APP 2019 #37
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED VV9

PAGE 6

May 13, 2019

IV. COMMUNICATIONS
1. Written Protest to the zoning petition filed by Stephen R. Karp, Trustee of Cambridgeside Galleria
Associates Trust (c/o New England Development), to amend the Zoning Ordinance by adding a
Section 13.100 that creates a new PUD-8 District and to amend the Zoning Map by adding the new
PUD-8 District, which District would include the property located at 100 Cambridgeside Place
(currently zoned in the Business A and PUD-4 Districts).
COM 290 #2019
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PETITION

2. A communication was received from Susan and Fred Good, 27 Gray Gardens East, regarding the
proposed 100% Affordable Housing Zoning Overlay.
COM 291 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

3. A communication was received from Peter Valentine, regarding living in a wonderful world.
COM 292 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication was received from Pauline Joseph, 6 Canal Park, regarding support for the PUD-8
petition by New England Development.
COM 293 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

5. A communication was received from Scott Haviland, General Manager, Tahaza Hummus Kitchen,
One Canal Park, regarding support for the development of the Sullivan Courthouse building in East
Cambridge.
COM 294 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

6. A communication was received from Robert L. Lindamood, 29 Otis Street, regarding the Sullivan
Courthouse redevelopment.
COM 295 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 7

May 13, 2019

7. A communication was received from Doug and Rebecca Castoldi, 82 Otis Street, regarding support
for the Sullivan Courthouse redevelopment.
COM 296 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

8. A communication was received from Frank Saviano, regarding opposition to an up-zoning from the
existing PUD-4 at this time.
COM 297 #2019
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PETITION

9. A communication was received from Shelley Rieman, 201 Franklin Street, regarding banning single
use plastics.
COM 298 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

10. Sundry communications were received in support of protected bicycle lanes.
COM 299 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

11. A communication was received from Melissa Ludtke, regarding supporting Policy order 6 that would
set in motion the process leading to writing and passage of a city ordinance that would ban and/or
sharply curtail the use of single-use plastic in the city of Cambridge.
COM 300 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

12. A communication was received from Joshua Hartshorne, expressing strong support of banning singleuse plastics and installing EV stations.
COM 301 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

13. A communication was received from Jeanne Koopman, River Street, regarding new funds for
affordable housing.
COM 302 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 8

May 13, 2019

14. A communication was received from Olga Slavin, 17 Otis Street, expressing frustration with the
continued delay of the redevelopment of the former Sullivan Courthouse.
COM 303 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

15. A communication was received from Sofia Rose Wolman, 453 Huron Avenue, regarding changing
the State Seal and Flag.
COM 304 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

16. A communication was received from Mark Tang, 32 Spring Street, regarding the bid by LMP GP
Holdings LLC that responds to the city of Cambridge's Request for Proposal for the leasing of 420
parking spaces and certain retail space at the First Street Garage.
COM 305 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

17. A written protest was received from Susan Morgan, 4 Canal Park, regarding the PUD-8 Petition.
COM 306 #2019
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PETITION

18. Sundry communication were received, regarding Policy Order #3 changes to the seal and Motto on
the State Flag.
COM 307 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

19. A communication was received from Itmar Turner-Trauring, regarding adding quick build protected
bike lanes.
COM 308 #2019
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 9

May 13, 2019

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Congratulations to Melissa and Maya Ludtke on the book "Touching Home in China."
Vice Mayor Devereux and entire membership.
RES 2019 #148
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

2. Congratulations to the Honorees at the Legacy Small Business Luncheon.
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Mallon and entire
membership.
RES 2019 #149
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

3. That the City Council go on record congratulating and commending the hard work of the award
recipients of the Cambridge Chamber of Commerce's 2019 Inspire Awards which celebrates the
achievements of women leaders.
Councillor Toomey, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Kelley, Councillor
Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui
and entire membership.
RES 2019 #150
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE
MEMBERS

4. Congratulations to the Pentecostal Tabernacle Jr. Bible Quiz Team for being selected to participate in
the Junior Bible Quiz National Championship in Tucson, Arizona in June 2019.
Councillor Simmons, Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2019 #151
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

5. Recognizing Abe Rybeck’s enduring good works in launching and guiding the Theater Offensive
over the course of its existence, and in wishing him well as he embarks upon his next exciting
chapter.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2019 #152
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

PAGE 10

May 13, 2019

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to contact AT&T, the owner of the parking lot located at the
corner of Bent Street and Sixth Street across from the Robert W. Healy Public Safety Facility, about
making improvements to their landscaping and taking better care of their property that abuts the
public way.
POR 2019 #167
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Toomey, Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE
MEMBERS

2. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Community Development Department, Traffic,
Parking and Transportation Department and Department of Public Works to determine what facilities,
parking changes, and other improvements to the pavement conditions would be necessary and
feasible to make Massachusetts Avenue a quick-build Complete Street between Sidney Street and
Putnam Avenue.
POR 2019 #168
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE
VOTE OF EIGHT MEMBERS
COUNCILLOR TOOMEY RECORDED AS PRESENT

3. City Council support of special commission to recommend changes to the seal and motto of the
Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
POR 2019 #169
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor
Simmons, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE
MEMBERS

4. That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant departments to explore establishing a
partnership between the City of Cambridge and the MBTA to offer CharlieCards at certain public
buildings throughout the city.
POR 2019 #170
Mayor McGovern, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

PAGE 11

May 13, 2019

5. That the City Manager is requested to join the Massachusetts Right to Counsel Coalition on behalf of
the City, signing “The City of Cambridge” on as an official supporter of the Massachusetts Right to
Counsel Campaign.
POR 2019 #171
Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

6. That the City Manager is requested to direct the Department of Public Works to work with the
Recycling Advisory Committee and other stakeholders to draft an ordinance banning single-use
plastic items in Cambridge.
POR 2019 #172
Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui,
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF EIGHT
MEMBERS

7. That the City Manager is requested to direct the Electrical Department, Department of Public Works,
Traffic, Parking and Transportation Department and the Community Development Department to
explore a pilot for Level 1 (110V) EV and Micromobility charging stations on street light poles
throughout the city.
POR 2019 #173
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Kelley, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

8. That the City Manager is requested to confer with Cambridge Police Department and other relevant
City staff on adding a cybercrime assessment section to the list of monthly Bridgstat reports or,
alternatively, create a separate report to help formalize the information flow about cybercrime to the
same level as the currently used Bridgstat
POR 2019 #174
Councillor Kelley, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

9. That the City Manager is requested to direct the Executive Director of the Election Commission and
the City Solicitor to report back to the City Council on potential ballot changes at a public hearing of
the Government Operations, Rules and Claims Committee on May 28, 2019.
POR 2019 #175
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

PAGE 12

May 13, 2019

10. The City Manager be and hereby is requested to instruct the City Solicitor to prepare a home rule
petition for the City Council to lower the voting age to sixteen (16) in municipal elections.
POR 2019 #234
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED BY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF SIX MEMBERS
COUNCILLOR TOOMEY AND COUNCILLOR KELLY IN THE NEGATIVE

PAGE 13

May 13, 2019
